https://github.com/mattermost/mattermost/issues/24976

comment.body:
We are passing here a new function on every render. I think I understand why you don't do just `onLongPress={handleLongPress}` since onLongPress will send an event, and will mess with the logic of `handleLongPress`. If that is the case, maybe another `useCallback` would work here.
```
const touchableHandleLongPress = useCallback(() => handleLongPress(), [handleLongPress]);
```

issue.title: Fix notifications not opening or going to the wrong channel on Android

labels.name: 2: Dev Review
labels.description: Requires review by a core commiter

issue.body:
#### Summary
(Still testing, pushing to discuss the solution)
Apparently, one of the patches was creating the notifications in a wrong way (as activity instead of as proper pending intent?).

Looking at the blame, it seems that the issue was about background notifications, that seem to be working fine with this change.

Also, updated the library since it is supposed to fix a few related things.

#### Ticket Link
Fix https://mattermost.atlassian.net/browse/MM-54406

#### Release Note
```release-note
Android: Fix issue where notifications don't open or open the wrong channel
```

comment.body:
Tested on Simulator APIs 26-34 by:

- Log in
- Send to the background
- Send a message on Channel A that trigger a notification
- Open the notification (works fine)
- Send to the background
- Send a message on Channel B that trigger a notification
- Use `adb shell am kill com.mattermost.rnbeta` to kill the app
- Open the notification (works fine)

commits.message: Handled case of no common team

issue.title: Incompatibility with Samsung Multi Window View
issue.body: The top of the Mattermost window's rendered elements gets an offset that, eyeballed, seems to be as far from the top of the window as the edge of the window from the edge of the screen. Without looking at the code it seems like the app is trying to prevent rendering culled elements by implementing a "blanking interval" at the top, but the window view renders everything into the window.

comment.body: one thing to note is that the offset gained persists statically through window movement and even leaving windowed mode entirely

issue.title: Incompatibility with Samsung Multi Window View
issue.body: The top of the Mattermost window's rendered elements gets an offset that, eyeballed, seems to be as far from the top of the window as the edge of the window from the edge of the screen. Without looking at the code it seems like the app is trying to prevent rendering culled elements by implementing a "blanking interval" at the top, but the window view renders everything into the window.

issue.title: fix: render latex in messages
issue.body: #### Summary Update `commonmark-react-renderer` package to the latest version. This will fix the following issues: - Show LaTex in the "Channels" view - Avoid error when clicking on "Threads" when a message contains LaTex - Show the max nodes warning for messages with too many nodes #### Ticket Link Fixes https://github.com/mattermost/mattermost/issues/24982 #### Checklist - [ ] Added or updated unit tests (required for all new features) - [x] Has UI changes - [ ] Includes text changes and localization file updates - [ ] Have tested against the 5 core themes to ensure consistency between them. #### Device Information This PR was tested on: IPhone SE, iOS 16.2 #### Screenshots | before | after | |----|----| | | | | | | | #### Release Note ```release-note * Fix rendering of LaTex messages ```

comment.body: @hmhealey here is the PR to update the library version :)

pull_request.title: fix: render latex in messages
pull_request.body: #### Summary Update `commonmark-react-renderer` package to the latest version. This will fix the following issues: - Show LaTex in the "Channels" view - Avoid error when clicking on "Threads" when a message contains LaTex - Show the max nodes warning for messages with too many nodes #### Ticket Link Fixes https://github.com/mattermost/mattermost/issues/24982 #### Checklist - [ ] Added or updated unit tests (required for all new features) - [x] Has UI changes - [ ] Includes text changes and localization file updates - [ ] Have tested against the 5 core themes to ensure consistency between them. #### Device Information This PR was tested on: IPhone SE, iOS 16.2 #### Screenshots | before | after | |----|----| | | | | | | | #### Release Note ```release-note * Fix rendering of LaTex messages ```

commits.message: Fix recent sorting difference with webapp (#7632)

pull_request.title: Fix recent sorting difference with webapp
pull_request.body:
#### Summary
Specially for DMs with no posts opened by yourself, the "recent" order on webapp and mobile was different.

Why is that? Because mobile only considers the last post at, while webapp considers the createAt too.

#### Ticket Link
Fix https://mattermost.atlassian.net/browse/MM-55144

#### Release Note
```release-note
Minor fix on channel order by recency
```

labels.name: 4: Reviews Complete
labels.description: All reviewers have approved the pull request

issue.title: Incompatibility with Samsung Multi Window View
issue.body: The top of the Mattermost window's rendered elements gets an offset that, eyeballed, seems to be as far from the top of the window as the edge of the window from the edge of the screen. Without looking at the code it seems like the app is trying to prevent rendering culled elements by implementing a "blanking interval" at the top, but the window view renders everything into the window.

comment.body: Hi @PG-Fuury, what Mattermost mobile app version and Mattermost server version are you on? What Samsung version are you using? Can you help share a screenshot of what you're seeing?

issue.title: Fix notifications not opening or going to the wrong channel on Android

labels.name: 2: Dev Review
labels.description: Requires review by a core commiter

issue.body:
#### Summary
(Still testing, pushing to discuss the solution)
Apparently, one of the patches was creating the notifications in a wrong way (as activity instead of as proper pending intent?).

Looking at the blame, it seems that the issue was about background notifications, that seem to be working fine with this change.

Also, updated the library since it is supposed to fix a few related things.

#### Ticket Link
Fix https://mattermost.atlassian.net/browse/MM-54406

#### Release Note
```release-note
Android: Fix issue where notifications don't open or open the wrong channel
```

comment.body:
> @enahum Only 12. Do you have any recommendation to test on all those versions? Or just run one simulator with each version and test?

Sim

comment.body: @larkox what versions of Android have you tested this? 8,9,10,11,12,13 upcoming 14, all those versions should work as expected

commits.message: Handled case of single common team
